title: Relates to the publication of notices of delinquent taxes
summary: Provides that prior to the publication of notices of delinquent taxes the enforcing officer shall determine if a transfer of title occurred subsequent to the taxable status date and in the event such transfer occurred, the published notices shall indicate the name of the new owner.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2733

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 20, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. CROUCH, GIGLIO -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Real Property Taxation

       AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to  the  publica-
         tion of notices of delinquent taxes

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 1 of section 1156 of the real property tax law,
    2  as amended by chapter 532 of the laws of 1994, is  amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    1.  Before  proceeding to enforce the collection of tax liens pursuant
    5  to this article, the enforcing officer shall publish such notices as the
    6  general, special or local laws relating  to  his  or  her  tax  district
    7  requires.  PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT PRIOR TO SUCH PUBLICATION THE ENFORC-
    8  ING OFFICER SHALL DETERMINE IF A TRANSFER OF TITLE TO ANY PARCEL OF REAL
    9  PROPERTY  HAVING  A  TAX LIEN THEREIN OCCURRED SUBSEQUENT TO THE TAXABLE
   10  STATUS DATE AND IN THE EVENT THAT SUCH TRANSFER OCCURRED, THE  PUBLISHED
   11  NOTICES  PURSUANT  TO  THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL INDICATE
   12  THE NAME OF THE NEW OWNER.
   13    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04558-01-1
